text: Hey, this is free account created only for HubSpot certification courses practice, but in the course they say - website has to be published...

Hi all, :wave: Has anyone successfully created a 'Subscription Center' that can be linked to without contacts needing to go to an email they were sent?

Ideally, we want a page where cookies & subscriptions for a contact can be viewed and managed on one page.
Hi <@U04B0F7N1A6>, how old is your free account?
If I remember correctly I had a similar problem back when I passed my certification and I solve my problem by creating a new account.
Hello everyone.....I'll like to know if there's a way to create dynamic pages using a template build with mdoules, ......attached is the screenshot of the template....Thanks

Hi <@U03AKL6Q1B2> - Sorry for the delay here. I would really appreciate it if you can assist us with this. Here's the page with the form. Scroll down all the way to the bottom where you'll see sign up form. <https://cbcspublicstaging.azurewebsites.net/>
Thank you so much in advance

Reminder: Did you know you can message <@U02162GK9SP|sprocky> at any time to get HubSpot development questions answered? It’s an experimental chat bot built to tackle developer questions. It won’t read your code, but can answer a lot of questions about building on the HubSpot platform.

Hi there, I am not a developer but rather I am in need of assistance from a developer. We have a HubSpot enterprise account with five business units. We are hoping to utilize an SMS app that unfortunately does have a native HubSpot integration. I am hoping that since this SMS app offers an open API that we can still send some information automatically from the SMS app to the activity log on the customer profile, or create a section on the customer profile for the SMS activity log.

If anyone here can help, please comment on this post. I am willing to pay for assistance within reason and can provide any context needed for the connections. Thank you
Hey Katie, you might like to post this in <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> as well

Hi everyone. I feel like this is a bit of a noob question. I got my start in javascript in the early 2000's and there used to be a way to just include the functions of one file in another. For <#C05R599UA12|ui-extensions>, is this possible? I'm querying an external API and would like to separate my authentication code from the other calls.
ah ha! I figured it out! I was just trying to call the function rather than accessing it through the object. All good now!
Hi there, anyone else having issues with the ACCOUNT_FETCH action type on custom app development? I'm getting SOCKET_TIMED_OUT error. This used to work before and just got this error yesterday
